subject: World Cup (Soccer)
lead_paragraph: Brazil, which has won a record five World Cups, was awarded the 2014 tournament yesterday by FIFA’s executive committee. Brazil last was the host of the competition in 1950, losing to Uruguay in the final. The unanimous vote came on the same day the 2011 Women’s World Cup was awarded to Germany, which beat out Canada. Germany was the host for the 2006 men’s World Cup. Brazil was the only candidate for the men’s 2014 World Cup because the rotation system meant it had to be played in South America. Colombia had said it would bid but withdrew in April.
